column4: i keep trying to mount hfs, but get: wrong fs type, bad option, bad superblock on /dev/loop0
maybe /dev/loop0 has a partition table header
if you modprobe dm, and then kpartx -a /dev/loop (something like this), you'll get /dev/mapper/loop0p1 stuff
ya but you have to paste what command you used
what do you mean by "modprobe dm"
my bad, i should have gotten familiar with it :)
not widely reported online, i made those notes like a year ago :)
i was in a heated debated with someone about using a script that was using predetermine presets.. but presets aren't the same for all table headers..
i told him you dont need a script to do mountpoints from an image.. so this is the safest way.. (kpartx, losetup, etc.)
did you list you losetup points?
you're supposed to use losetup if you're trying to bound a rawimage
you can ask me on #linux, this seems very unubuntu
